pageTitle: MEC Ottawa - Mountain Equipment Co-op (MEC). Free Shipping Available.
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {9862=May 25 - Sep 06, 2881=In 1992, we built our Ottawa store in an old movie theatre. It quickly became a popular attraction and a larger location was soon needed. In 2000 we moved into another reconditioned building, and over time expanded it into a 25,000 square-foot store. The building was the first retail store in Canada to comply with C2000 Green Building Certification., 630=Bike Shop Phone: 613-729-2700, 1054=Contact Chris Chapman about any of store programs: chris.chapman@mec.ca, or 613.729.2700, 13005=366 Richmond Road Ottawa, Ontario K2A 0E8 Manager: Dave Rayner 613.729.2700}

textBeforeTable: Call the store to set up a bike shop visit. A tune-up may take two to four business days. Minor repairs can be done while you shop. Our bike shop can provide any repair from minor service, like installing fenders, to a deluxe overhaul. If you're not sure what kind of work your bike needs, bring it in for a free safety inspection. Our mechanics will inspect it, consult with you, and if it needs service, determine the best package value for your bike's condition. Bike Shop Phone: 613-729-2700 MEC Ottawa Bike Shop Contact Chris Chapman about any of store programs: chris.chapman@mec.ca, or 613.729.2700 We offer free presentations and informational store tours to interested student groups, outdoor organizations, environmental organizations, or business. Topics range learning about outdoor gear and trip planning to corporate responsibility and environmental sustainability practices. Seminars and Store Tours Our meeting room can accommodate small groups, and is available to local outdoor clubs, ENGOs, or NGOs that have a similar mandate as MEC. We have audio visual equipment (not including laptop computers), white boards, and flip charts. Use of our space is free. If interested, please email us at least a month in advance of your event. See contact information below Community Meeting Room See our Community Contributions programs MEC supports grassroots organizations and their efforts to conserve ecologically and recreationally important places and to inspire and enable Canadians to be
textAfterTable: Wheels trued radially and laterally. Spoke tension checked/adjusted. Crankset removed, bottom bracket tapers cleaned. Front and rear hub bearings adjusted. Derailleur and cable tension checked or adjusted. Derailleur hanger aligned if needed. All pivot points lubricated. Threadlock applied to crank bolt, rotor bolts, caliper bolts, and loose hardware. Brake cable tension, shoe height, and angle checked or adjusted. Centre orientation confirmed. Headset checked for proper bearing adjustment, adjusted as needed. Bottom bracket checked for proper bearing adjustment. Tires filled to maximum stated pressure. Stem, handlebar, seat, controls, seatpost, and crankarms checked and adjusted. Add-on Services: bike cleaning
